onlineAddresses.caption: Restoration Road - Official Trailer | Magnolia Network
Road to Launch with Clint Harp | Magnolia Network

speakerTopic.text: Clint shares his remarkable journey from being on the brink of financial collapse to an unlikely starring role on the HGTV hit show "Fixer Upper". With the support of his family, Clint gave up a successful sales career to pursue his unfulfilled dream of building furniture and launching Harp Design Co.  Clint imparts the importance of meaningful work, turning your craft into a career, and recognizing the importance of the journey itself.  Clint provides an unvarnished, thoughtful reflection on a path that is possible for anyone bold enough to pursue it.
speakerTopic.title: #LoveBuildRun

speakerBioSummary.text:
• Clint Harp is the star of Restoration Road, a unique look at the time, effort, and passion that goes into restoration, featured on Chip and Joanna Gaines' Magnolia Network & Discovery+.
  • He is also the host of the Man Unmade podcast, which focuses on normalizing the authority and power of women’s voices in a man’s ear.
  • Clint formerly starred on HGTV's hit series Fixer Upper and the DIY shows Wood Work and Against the Grain.
  • Fixer Upper attracted more than 19 million viewers in its first season.
  • Clint founded Harp Design Co., which provides quality furniture and home goods to customers across the U.S. and abroad.

speakerBiography.text:
Clint Harp is a dumpster-diving, reclaimed-wood-loving carpenter who is the star of Restoration Road on Chip and Joanna Gaines' Magnolia Network & Discovery+. The show is a unique look at the time, effort and passion that goes into restoration. He could be seen regularly on HGTV’s hit series Fixer Upper and the DIY Network shows Wood Work and Against the Grain.

Clint is also the host of the Man Unmade podcast where he listens and learns from the stories and experiences of women with the goal of normalizing the authority and power of women’s voices in a man’s ear.

After quitting his sales job in 2011 to pursue his dream of building furniture, Clint and his wife Kelly started Harp Design Co., creating quality, eco-friendly furniture from recycled and reclaimed wood for customers across the U.S. and abroad. The Harps work hard each day to grow as a family and a business whose core values are love, beauty, and creativity.

Clint appeared as a supporting role in Fixer Upper, helping his close friends and stars Chip and Joanna Gaines as they remodel homes in Waco, Texas. The show attracted more than 19 million viewers its first season and remained popular into its fifth and final season. As a regular on the show, Clint would take recycled and reclaimed wood, usually scavenged, and create beautiful, one-of-a-kind pieces meant to bring families together, which the Gaines would then incorporate into their final remodel and home designs.

Following Fixer Upper, Clint began work on his own projects, DIY Network shows Wood Work and Against the Grain. Along with his wife Kelly and the team at Harp Design Co, Clint uses reclaimed lumber to build new furniture for clients. Crazy requests with tight deadlines are the norm, but Clint and his team are ready to tackle any and every challenge.
